workflow.name: Role-based access control (RBAC) for Telegram automations
workflow.description:
# üîê n8n Workflow: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) for Telegram Automations
This n8n workflow lets you control access to your internal Telegram bots and automation systems based on user roles and departments.
It ensures that only authorized team members ‚Äî defined in your employee database ‚Äî can interact with specific parts of your workflow.
Perfect for agencies, internal tools, or multi-team organizations where permissions differ across roles (e.g., Marketing, Sales, Administration).

## üìå Section 1: Trigger & Input
‚ö° Receive Message (Telegram Trigger)
Purpose: Captures incoming messages from users interacting with your Telegram bot.

### How it works:
When a user sends any message to the bot, the workflow retrieves their Telegram username and triggers the process.

### Benefit:
Provides a secure and instant entry point for validating user identity before running any internal logic.

## üìå Section 2: Role Lookup
üìã Employee Database (Data Table Node)
Purpose: Fetches user details such as Position and Type from your internal employee table.

Structure Example:

UserName===Position===Type
User_1===Marketing===SEO
User_2===Administration===Manager
User_3===Marketing===Target

### Benefit:
Centralized employee management ‚Äî you can update access levels (roles or departments) directly in the data table without editing the workflow.

## üìå Section 3: Position & Role Check
### üß© Choose Position (Switch Node)
Purpose: Determines the user‚Äôs department or role level (e.g., Marketing, Sales, Administration).

### üß© Check Role Type (Switch Node)
Purpose: Performs a second-level check ‚Äî filters users by Type (e.g., SEO, SMM, Target).

### Logic:
Marketing ‚Üí SEO ‚Üí Send to SEO workflow branch
Marketing ‚Üí Target ‚Üí Send to Ads branch
Administration ‚Üí Manager ‚Üí Grant full access
Sales ‚Üí Employee ‚Üí Limited access

### Benefit:
Allows multi-level, role-based logic with different automation paths for each team or position.

## üìå Section 4: Action Routing
üí¨ No Operation Nodes (Placeholders)
Purpose: Represent different action branches ‚Äî each can later be replaced with the logic specific to that department.

### Examples:
‚ÄúTarget‚Äù branch ‚Üí connect to ad performance automation
‚ÄúSEO‚Äù branch ‚Üí connect to Google Search Console reports
‚ÄúSales‚Äù branch ‚Üí connect to CRM updates

### Benefit:
A flexible access framework ‚Äî ready to integrate with any process per department.

üìä Workflow Overview Table

Section	Node Name	Purpose
1. Trigger	Telegram Trigger	Captures user messages
2. Lookup	Employee Database	Fetches user position and type
3. Check	Choose Position / Role Switch	Defines access path based on role
4. Routing	No Operation Nodes	Separate workflows per department

## üéØ Key Benefits

üîê Granular Access Control: Multi-level permission logic (Position + Role).
‚öôÔ∏è Dynamic Role Management: Update access directly in your data table ‚Äî no redeployment needed.
üß± Modular Design: Add or replace department branches without affecting core logic.
üöÄ Scalable Foundation: Perfect base for enterprise-grade permission systems or multi-team bots.
üìà Cross-Platform Ready: Can be adapted for Slack, Discord, or internal chat tools.

workflow.name: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) for Telegram Automations

parameters.content:
## Instruction

**1. Prepare Employee Table**
Create a Data Table with columns:
UserName===Position===Type

User_1===Marketing===SEO  
User_2===Sales===Manager  
User_3===Administration===HR


Select this table in the Employee database node (Data Table ID).

**2. Configure Access Logic**

Switch (Position): {{$json.Position}}
‚Üí branches: Marketing, Sales, Administration

Inside Marketing: Switch (Role) ‚Üí {{ $('Employee database').item.json.Type }}
‚Üí roles: Target, SEO, SMM

**3. Customize Role Actions**

Target ‚Üí performance tracking

SEO ‚Üí Telegram confirmation / analytics sync

SMM ‚Üí content posting

Sales / Administration ‚Üí custom workflows

**4. Test the Flow**
Activate workflow ‚Üí send Telegram message ‚Üí
system checks username ‚Üí finds Position & Type ‚Üí routes to correct branch.

user.bio: Business Automation & E-commerce Expert | Founder & Entrepreneur | N8n.io & Make.com Specialist | Automate ‚Äã>80% of routine tasks ‚Äî helping businesses reduce costs and accelerate processes

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
